Yin Tat Lee receives Microsoft Research Faculty Fellowship

. Apr 30, 2019.
1 minute read

Professor Yin Tat Lee of the Allen Schoolâ€™s Theory of Computation group has been named a 2019 Microsoft Research Faculty Fellow. Since 2005, Microsoft has used its Faculty Fellowship program to recognize promising, early-career researchers whose exceptional research talent makes them emerging leaders in their fields. Lee, who joined the University of Washington faculty in 2017, is one of only five recipients selected by Microsoft this year from universities and colleges across North America.

More details can be found in the Allen School news post.
